byline.original: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and HELENE COOPER

abstract: Star-studded dedication of Martin Luther King Jr memorial in Washington, monument more than two decades in making, is marked by strong sense of pride in history of civil rights movement; keynote speech is delivered by Pres Obama, who points to himself as beneficiary of King's work.
snippet: The Martin Luther King Jr. memorial — a four-acre tract along the Tidal Basin that is anchored by an imposing granite statue of Dr. King — is the result of more than two decades of work.
lead_paragraph: The Martin Luther King Jr. memorial — a four-acre tract along the Tidal Basin that is anchored by an imposing granite statue of Dr. King — is the result of more than two decades of work.

headline.main: A Dedication to King, and the Work Yet to Do
headline.print_headline: A Dedication to King, And the Work Yet to Do
headline.seo: Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Dedicated in Washington
